intro: Jamesbrittenia namaquensis, commonly known as the Namaqua daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers with a central disc. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, inconspicuous fruits. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its drought tolerance and vibrant blooms.
